ActivateInstance.document: This API is used to remove the isolation of an instance to make it accessible again.
ActivateInstance.name: Removes the isolation of an instance to make it accessible again

AddClusterSlaveZone.document: This API is used to add the replica AZ.
AddClusterSlaveZone.name: Adds the replica AZ

AddInstances.document: This API is used to add an instance in a cluster.
AddInstances.name: Adds instance in cluster

CreateAccounts.document: This API is used to create an account.
CreateAccounts.name: Creates an account

CreateBackup.document: This API is used to create manual backup.
CreateBackup.name: Creates manual backup

CreateClusters.document: This API is used to create a cluster.
CreateClusters.name: Creates a cluster

DeleteBackup.document: This API is used to delete the manual backup for a cluster. It cannot be used to delete the automatic backup.
DeleteBackup.name: Deletes the manual backup

DescribeAccounts.document: This API is used to query database management accounts.
DescribeAccounts.name: Queries database management accounts

DescribeBackupConfig.document: This API is used to get the backup configuration information of the specified cluster, including the full backup time range and backup file retention period.
DescribeBackupConfig.name: Queries backup configuration information

DescribeBackupDownloadUrl.document: This API is used to query the download address of a cluster backup file.
DescribeBackupDownloadUrl.name: Queries the download address of a backup file

DescribeBackupList.document: This API is used to query the list of backup files.
DescribeBackupList.name: Queries backup file list

DescribeBinlogDownloadUrl.document: This API is used to query the download address of a binlog.
DescribeBinlogDownloadUrl.name: Queries the download address of a binlog

DescribeBinlogSaveDays.document: This API is used to query the binlog retention period of a cluster in days.
DescribeBinlogSaveDays.name: Queries the binlog retention period in days

DescribeBinlogs.document: This API is used to query the list of binlogs in a cluster.
DescribeBinlogs.name: Queries the list of binlogs

DescribeClusterDetail.document: This API is used to display cluster details.
DescribeClusterDetail.name: Displays cluster details

DescribeClusterInstanceGrps.document: This API is used to query instance groups.
DescribeClusterInstanceGrps.name: Queries instance groups

DescribeClusterParams.document: This API is used to query the parameters of a cluster.
DescribeClusterParams.name: Queries the parameters of a cluster

DescribeClusters.document: This API is used to the list of clusters.
DescribeClusters.name: Queries cluster list

DescribeDBSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group information of an instance.
DescribeDBSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group information of instance

DescribeInstanceDetail.document: This API is used to query instance details.
DescribeInstanceDetail.name: Queries instance details

DescribeInstanceSlowQueries.document: This API is used to query the slow query logs of an instance.
DescribeInstanceSlowQueries.name: Queries the slow query logs of an instance

DescribeInstanceSpecs.document: This API is used to query instance specifications.
DescribeInstanceSpecs.name: Queries instance specifications

DescribeInstances.document: This API is used to query the list of instances.
DescribeInstances.name: Queries instance list

DescribeMaintainPeriod.document: This API is used to query the instance maintenance window.
DescribeMaintainPeriod.name: Queries instance maintenance window

DescribeParamTemplates.document: This API is used to query all parameter templates information of a user-specified product.
DescribeParamTemplates.name: Queries the information of parameter templates

DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group information of a project.
DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group information of project

DescribeResourcesByDealName.document: This API is used to query the list of resources by billing order ID.
DescribeResourcesByDealName.name: Queries resource information by order ID

DescribeRollbackTimeRange.document: This API is used to query the valid rollback time range for the specified cluster.
DescribeRollbackTimeRange.name: Queries valid rollback time range

DescribeRollbackTimeValidity.document: This API is used to query whether rollback is possible based on the specified time and cluster.
DescribeRollbackTimeValidity.name: Queries whether rollback is possible based on specified time

ExportInstanceSlowQueries.document: This API is used to export the slow logs of an instance.
ExportInstanceSlowQueries.name: Exports the slow logs of an instance

InquirePriceCreate.document: This API is used to query the purchasable price of a cluster.
InquirePriceCreate.name: Queries the purchasable price of a cluster

InquirePriceRenew.document: This API is used to query the renewal price of a cluster.
InquirePriceRenew.name: Queries the renewal price of a cluster

IsolateCluster.document: This API is used to isolate a cluster.
IsolateCluster.name: Isolates cluster

IsolateInstance.document: This API is used to isolate an instance.
IsolateInstance.name: Isolates instance

ModifyBackupConfig.document: This API is used to modify the backup configuration of the specified cluster.
ModifyBackupConfig.name: Modifies backup configuration

ModifyBackupName.document: This API is used to rename a backup file.
ModifyBackupName.name: Renames a backup file

ModifyClusterName.document: This API is used to modify cluster name.
ModifyClusterName.name: Modifies cluster name

ModifyClusterParam.document: This API is used to modify the parameters of a cluster.
ModifyClusterParam.name: Modifies the parameters of a cluster

ModifyClusterSlaveZone.document: This API is used to modify the replica AZ.
ModifyClusterSlaveZone.name: Modifies the replica AZ

ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to modify the security groups bound to an instance.
ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroups.name: Modifies security groups bound to instance

ModifyInstanceName.document: This API is used to modify instance name.
ModifyInstanceName.name: Modifies instance name

ModifyMaintainPeriodConfig.document: This API is used to modify the maintenance time configuration.
ModifyMaintainPeriodConfig.name: Modifies maintenance time configuration

OfflineCluster.document: This API is used to deactivate a cluster.
OfflineCluster.name: Deactivates cluster

OfflineInstance.document: This API is used to deactivate an instance.
OfflineInstance.name: Deactivates instance

PauseServerless.document: This API is used to pause a serverless cluster.
PauseServerless.name: Pauses a serverless cluster

RemoveClusterSlaveZone.document: This API is used to delete the replica AZ.
RemoveClusterSlaveZone.name: Deletes the replica AZ

ResumeServerless.document: This API is used to resume a serverless cluster.
ResumeServerless.name: Resumes a serverless cluster

SetRenewFlag.document: This API is used to set auto-renewal for an instance.
SetRenewFlag.name: Sets auto-renewal

SwitchClusterZone.document: This API is used to switch to the replica AZ.
SwitchClusterZone.name: Switches to the replica AZ

UpgradeInstance.document: This API is used to upgrade an instance.
UpgradeInstance.name: Upgrades instance

members.document: List of instance IDs in the format of `cynosdbmysql-ins-n7ocdslw` as displayed in the TDSQL-C for MySQL console. You can use the instance list querying API to query the ID, i.e., the `InstanceId` value in the output parameters.
members.name: InstanceIdList

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Number of added read-only instances. Value range: (0,16].
members.name: ReadOnlyCount

members.document: Instance group ID, which is used when you add an instance to an existing RO group. If this parameter is left empty, an RO group will be created. We recommend you not pass in this value on the current version.
members.name: InstanceGrpId

members.document: VPC ID. This parameter has been disused.
members.name: VpcId

members.document: Subnet ID. If `VpcId` is set, `SubnetId` is required. This parameter has been disused.
members.name: SubnetId

members.document: The port used when adding an RO group. Value range: [0,65535).
members.name: Port

members.document: Whether to automatically select a voucher. 1: yes; 0: no. Default value: 0
members.name: AutoVoucher

members.document: Transaction mode. Valid values: `0` (place and pay for an order), `1` (place an order)
members.name: DealMode

members.document:
Freezing transaction. One freezing transaction ID is generated each time an instance is added.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TranId

members.document:
Pay-as-You-Go order ID.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DealNames

List of IDs of delivered resources
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ResourceIds

Big order ID.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: BigDealIds

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Snapshot file ID, which is deprecated. You need to use `BackupId`.
members.name: SnapshotId

members.document: Backup type. Valid values: `snapshot` (snapshot backup), `logic` (logic backup).
members.name: BackupType

members.document: Back mode. auto: auto backup; manual: manual backup
members.name: BackupMethod

members.document:
Backup ID
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: BackupId

members.document:
Backup file alias
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Backup type. Valid values: `logic` (logic backup), `snapshot` (physical backup)
members.name: BackupType

members.document: Backup database, which is valid when `BackupType` is `logic`.
members.name: BackupDatabases

members.document: Backup table, which is valid when `BackupType` is `logic`.
members.name: BackupTables

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Database version. Valid values:
  • Valid values for `MYSQL`: 5.7 and 8.0
members.name: DbVersion

members.document:
It is required when `DbMode` is set to `NORMAL` or left empty.
Number of CPU cores of normal instance
members.name: Cpu

members.document:
It is required when `DbMode` is set to `NORMAL` or left empty.
Memory of a non-serverless instance in GB
members.name: Memory

members.document:
This parameter has been deprecated.
Storage capacity in GB
members.name: Storage

members.document: Cluster name, which can contain less than 64 letters, digits, or symbols (-_.).
members.name: ClusterName

members.document: Account password, which must contain 8-64 characters in at least three of the following four types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, and symbols (~!@#$%^&*_-+=`|\(){}[]:;'<>,.?/).
members.name: AdminPassword

members.document: Billing mode. `0`: pay-as-you-go; `1`: monthly subscription. Default value: `0`
members.name: PayMode

members.document: Number of purchased clusters. Valid range: [1,50]. Default value: 1
members.name: Count
RollbackStrategy

members.document: `snapshotId` for snapshot rollback or `queryId` for time point rollback. 0 indicates to determine whether the time point is valid
members.name: RollbackId

members.document: The source cluster ID passed in during rollback to find the source `poolId`
members.name: OriginalClusterId

members.document: Specified time for time point rollback or snapshot time for snapshot rollback
members.name: ExpectTime

members.document:
This parameter has been deprecated.
Specified allowed time range for time point rollback
members.name: ExpectTimeThresh

members.document:
Storage upper limit of normal instance in GB
If `DbType` is `MYSQL` and the storage billing mode is monthly subscription, the parameter value can’t exceed the maximum storage corresponding to the CPU and memory specifications.
members.name: StorageLimit

members.document: Purchase duration of monthly subscription plan
members.name: TimeSpan

members.document: Duration unit of monthly subscription. Valid values: `s`, `d`, `m`, `y`
members.name: TimeUnit

members.document: Whether auto-renewal is enabled for monthly subscription plan. Default value: `0`
members.name: AutoRenewFlag

members.document: Whether to automatically select a voucher. `1`: yes; `0`: no. Default value: `0`
members.name: AutoVoucher

members.document: Number of instances (this parameter has been disused and is retained only for compatibility with existing instances)
members.name: HaCount

members.document: Array of tags to be bound to the created cluster
members.name: ResourceTags

members.document:
Database type Valid values when `DbType` is `MYSQL` (default value: `NORMAL`):
  • NORMAL
  • SERVERLESS
members.name: DbMode

members.document:
This parameter is required if `DbMode` is `SERVERLESS`.
Minimum number of CPU cores. For the value range, see the returned result of `DescribeServerlessInstanceSpecs`.
members.name: MinCpu

members.document:
This parameter is required if `DbMode` is `SERVERLESS`.
Maximum number of CPU cores. For the value range, see the returned result of `DescribeServerlessInstanceSpecs`.
members.name: MaxCpu

members.document:
This parameter specifies whether the cluster will be automatically paused if `DbMode` is `SERVERLESS`. Valid values:
  • yes
  • no
    • Default value: yes
members.name: AutoPause

members.document:
This parameter specifies the delay for automatic cluster pause in seconds if `DbMode` is `SERVERLESS`. Value range: [600,691200]
Default value: `600`
members.name: AutoPauseDelay

members.document:
The billing mode of cluster storage. Valid values: `0` (pay-as-you-go), `1` (monthly subscription). Default value: `0`.
If `DbType` is `MYSQL` and the billing mode of cluster compute is pay-as-you-go (or the `DbMode` is `SERVERLESS`), the billing mode of cluster storage must be pay-as-you-go.
Clusters with storage billed in monthly subscription can’t be cloned or rolled back.
members.name: StoragePayMode

members.document: Transaction mode. Valid values: `0` (place and pay for an order), `1` (place an order)
members.name: DealMode

members.document: Parameter template ID, which can be obtained by querying parameter template information “DescribeParamTemplates”
members.name: ParamTemplateId

Freezing transaction ID
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

Order ID

members.name: DealNames

members.name: BackupTimeBeg

members.document: Backup retention period in seconds. Backups will be cleared after this period elapses. 7 days is represented by 3600*24*7 = 604800. Maximum value: 158112000.
members.name: ReserveDuration

members.document: Backup frequency. It is an array of 7 elements corresponding to Monday through Sunday. full: full backup; increment: incremental backup. This parameter cannot be modified currently and doesn't need to be entered.
members.name: BackupFreq

members.document: Backup mode. logic: logic backup; snapshot: snapshot backup. This parameter cannot be modified currently and doesn't need to be entered.
members.name: BackupType

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Backup name, which can contain up to 60 characters.
members.name: BackupName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: List of the parameters to be modified. Each element in the list is a combination of `ParamName`, `CurrentValue`, and `OldValue`. `ParamName` is the parameter name; `CurrentValue` is the current value; `OldValue` is the old value that doesn’t need to be verified.
members.name: ParamList

members.document: Valid values: `yes` (execute during maintenance time), `no` (execute now)
members.name: IsInMaintainPeriod

members.document: Async request ID used to query the result
members.name: AsyncRequestId

members.document: Maintenance start time in seconds. For example, 03:00 AM is represented by 10800
members.name: MaintainStartTime

members.document: Maintenance duration in seconds. For example, one hour is represented by 3600
members.name: MaintainDuration

members.document: Maintenance days of the week. Valid values: [Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun].
members.name: MaintainWeekDays

members.document:
The non-discounted total price of monthly subscribed resources (unit: US cent)
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TotalPrice

members.document:
The discounted total price of monthly subscribed resources (unit: US cent). If a discount is applied, `TotalPriceDiscount` will be the product of `TotalPrice` and `Discount`.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TotalPriceDiscount

members.document:
The non-discounted unit price of pay-as-you-go resources (unit: US cent)
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: UnitPrice

members.document:
The discounted unit price of pay-as-you-go resources (unit: US cent). If a discount is applied, `UnitPriceDiscount` will be the product of `UnitPrice` and `Discount`.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: UnitPriceDiscount

members.document: Upgrade type. Valid values: upgradeImmediate, upgradeInMaintain
members.name: UpgradeType

members.document: Whether to automatically select a voucher. 1: yes; 0: no. Default value: 0
members.name: AutoVoucher

members.document: Transaction mode. Valid values: `0` (place and pay for an order), `1` (place an order)
members.name: DealMode
